title: High ping problem
body: my ping is to high (450-300) when i ping through command prompt to roit server i get 40-35 and when i switch to PBE account its around 50 I tried all fixes and tried to change the dns to 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4 it lowered the ping a bit to 250 any help?

replies.body:
Did you end up working through the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety? A lot of latency issues end up being caused by certain network settings that don't play well with League, so working through those steps will ensure your local network settings are compatible.

If you see these latency issues persist through the changes in that guide, let me know.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=wBLP0EKB,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-01-12T23:36:37.631+0000)
>
> Did you end up working through the [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety? A lot of latency issues end up being caused by certain network settings that don't play well with League, so working through those steps will ensure your local network settings are compatible.
> 
> If you see these latency issues persist through the changes in that guide, let me know.

where is the guide?
here is test i just did http://imgur.com/a/PgX7J

I linked it in my first reply. Here it is again in plain text:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues

Give all those steps a try if you haven't already. If you continue to experience issues, we'll take a closer look at your network routing.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=wBLP0EKB,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2017-01-16T21:19:08.771+0000)
>
> I linked it in my first reply. Here it is again in plain text:
> 
> https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues
> 
> Give all those steps a try if you haven't already. If you continue to experience issues, we'll take a closer look at your network routing.

thanks I already tried all the steps it didn't help and I had a tech guy came today and replaced my modem still same problem I only have this with leage of legends not the other games

In that case, I'd like you to run a traceroute log, as it will provide really detailed information about your network route and reveal any issues there. I suggest using the networking app [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete this log. After you've opened to app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your trace results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you ran into any issues.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=wBLP0EKB,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-16T23:18:14.501+0000)
>
> In that case, I'd like you to run a traceroute log, as it will provide really detailed information about your network route and reveal any issues there. I suggest using the networking app [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete this log. After you've opened to app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field and start the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your trace results as text and paste them in a reply to me.
> 
> Let me know if you ran into any issues.

Thanks for running that traceroute! It looks like your latency hike begins on the first hop outside of your home network at a high of **116ms**. Your latency spikes and fluctuates a few times over your route, hitting a high of **819ms** before reaching our servers. I recommend reaching out to your ISP's tier 2 support and provide this traceroute so they can launch an investigation.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
